qa_data.question: What should I do if my ID card is lost or stolen?
qa_data.answer: If your ID card is lost or stolen, you can get a reprint of your card by providing your card number and biometrics for authentication. No further documentation is needed for this process.

qa_data.question: Do I need to provide documents for a lost ID card reprint?
qa_data.answer: No, you do not need to provide any documents for a lost ID card reprint. You only need to provide your card number and biometrics for authentication.

qa_data.question: What information do I need to provide for a lost ID card reprint?
qa_data.answer: You need to provide your card number and biometrics (for authentication purposes). No additional documentation is required.

qa_data.question: How is my identity verified when applying for a lost ID card reprint?
qa_data.answer: Your identity is verified through biometrics authentication. The system will match your fingerprints and other biometric data to confirm your identity.

qa_data.question: Will my new ID card have the same expiration date as the lost one?
qa_data.answer: Yes, the newly issued ID card will have the same expiration date as the old one that was lost or stolen.

qa_data.question: Does the reprint process change my card's validity period?
qa_data.answer: No, the reprint process does not change your card's validity period. The new card will maintain the same expiration date as your original lost card.

qa_data.question: Can I get a reprint if my ID card was stolen?
qa_data.answer: Yes, you can get a reprint whether your ID card was lost or stolen. The same process applies - provide your card number and biometrics for authentication.

qa_data.question: Do I need to file a police report for a stolen ID card before getting a reprint?
qa_data.answer: Based on the reprint process, no police report is required for getting a reprint of a lost or stolen ID card. You only need your card number and biometric verification.

qa_data.question: What if I don't remember my card number for the reprint?
qa_data.answer: While the standard process requires your card number, you should contact NADRA directly if you don't remember it. Your biometric data may help them locate your record in their system.

qa_data.question: Can someone else apply for a reprint of my lost ID card on my behalf?
qa_data.answer: No, since biometric authentication is required for verification, you must personally visit the NADRA center to apply for a reprint of your lost ID card.

qa_data.question: How long does it take to get a reprint of a lost ID card?
qa_data.answer: The processing time for a reprint would follow the standard NADRA processing categories: Normal (30 days), Urgent (12 days), or Executive (7 days), depending on which service level you choose.

qa_data.question: Is there a fee for reprinting a lost ID card?
qa_data.answer: Yes, there is a fee for reprinting a lost ID card. The fee would be the same as the standard CNIC modification/duplicate fee according to the processing category you select.

qa_data.question: Can I use PAK-ID app to apply for a lost ID card reprint?
qa_data.answer: Yes, you can use the PAK-ID mobile application to apply for a reprint of your lost ID card, as it provides various NADRA services including document reprints.

qa_data.question: What is the difference between a reprint and a duplicate card?
qa_data.answer: For lost or stolen cards, the process is essentially the same as getting a duplicate card. Both involve getting a replacement card with the same information and expiration date as the original.

qa_data.question: Are there any security measures to prevent misuse of lost ID cards?
qa_data.answer: Yes, when you report your card as lost and get a reprint, the old card number may be flagged in the system to prevent misuse. The biometric verification requirement also adds security to the reprint process.
